TopicTitle: [0.23.5] StretchySRB: A StretchyTanks Continuation v9 Final Pre-PP edition 3/21/14

Articles.Content: Better first remove Stretchy Tanks completely and install v7 again and see if that problem persists..

Will replacing original stretchy tanks with this break my existing craft files with stretchy tank parts?

It shouldn't break them

How do you make the tanks conical? R changes length, t is for texture and f for width right? There's nothing in the readme to explain how to do it.

It's a new tank in v7 that has a separately-scalable top and and bottom.

You probably already know this but if you copy the service module .cfg that you're using there and change the names slightly, I use the suffix long on the title and name, with the modifications below, you get modules the same width but at twice the height. Reducing part count and giving doors twice the height, if that's the sort of thing you're looking for?

This is hysterical because it's what I'd planned on doing this morning before my next rocket mission! GET OUT OF MY HEAD!!

Better first remove Stretchy Tanks completely and install v7 again and see if that problem persists..

Yep that was it. Weird, thanks for the suggestion.

These conical tanks are cool...FACT. Great work Nathan.

This is hysterical because it's what I'd planned on doing this morning before my next rocket mission! GET OUT OF MY HEAD!!

And for my next trick...

I found up to about 3 times the original length they look fine, much greater than that and they start to look a little warped and stuff. I also added another attachment node at the centre of them just for ease of fitting stuff if needed. These things are totally cool for putting KAS winches and stuff like that in there though.

Yep that was it. Weird, thanks for the suggestion.

This should always be the first thing to do before sorting out any incompatibilities and making the modder search for the cause of the problem. The good old "plug out and plug in " - method is often working

This should always be the first thing to do before sorting out any incompatibilities and making the modder search for the cause of the problem. The good old "plug out and plug in " - method is often working

That is why I posted on here, see if anyone was experiencing problems. You reminded me of this though...
That is hilarious

Would it be too hard to implement a grain configuration that decreases thrust as the SRB burns out? I'm building sounding rockets to test the heat shields of my sample return / impactor thing and the TWR at the later stages of the burn approach crazy values like 10+ which leads to g-force disintegration with DRE v4. This can be mitigated to a limited extent by increasing the burn time, but it would be nice to have a specific option for this. What do you think, Nathan?

http://pastebin.com/Ya2bn03L

Getting a crash when trying to launch said sounding rocket. Didn't have any problems like this before I updated to StretchySRB v7 & RSS 5.3. I did build it from scratch after updating. Not sure what's going on.
HoneyFox made an SRB thrust controller, and it's going to be integrated into MFS sooner or later. That'd probably do it.

Broken. Tried it just now, all looks to work ok, but the fuel type defaults to Liquid/oxidizer once the ship is launched... also I thought jet engines could burn the fuel from these tanks, but my engine would not start. fuel deprived (although it was attached to a liquid fuel/oxidizer tank directly). This is only my first test on trying to make a working jet in .23.

Edit: A bit more testing. Liquid fuel/oxidizer tanks work fine. so mostly working.
